description.narrative: Removal of key barriers that prevent the wide adoption of energy efficiency technologies and measures in the IRS
Total direct energy savings by EOP billion kWh

comment.narrative:
1 Institutional Barrier
a TIRFAD is set up at RDSO to collect disseminate relevant information provide technical back up to implement EE technologies
b Center of Excellence is set up at IRIEEN Nasik has improved the existing training and testing facilities to have the proper equipment to test the EE technologies train IR staff and officials on energy efficiency
2 Information and capacity barriers
A webportal wwwrailsaverin has been developed to access information data on energy consumption for non traction traction and workshops over entire Indian Railways system An agency was hired to analyse Energy Efficiency opportunities in traction and non traction operation A report prepared by the agency is planned this year to be disseminated by Min of Railways
3 Incentive Barrier
The energy consumption data from the web portal is being analyzed facilitating planning procurement decisions and targeted savings at zonal level and Min of Railways
4 Technology Barrier
An energy lab is being set up at IRIEEN It shall help in setting up the procedures for testing of electrical equipments
5 Financial Barrier
The steps implemented for the above barriers shall assist in controlling the expenditure on energy consumption and energy consuming products equipments
In addition the subprojects interventions as identified in the project shall be able to give results for energy saving of 00173 million kWh equivalent to 0117 million t CO2 per year
